descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course develops listening skills and critical vocabulary in order to refine the ways we write and talk about our musical experiences, with particular attention to the kinds of experiences afforded by music from the past. Throughout the quarter, our study of specific musical practices and geographies will be grounded in primary documents from a variety of historical moments, ranging from Ancient Greek culture through 18th-century colonial encounters to the contemporary music landscape. Class time will be spent discussing assigned listening and readings, listening as a group, and practicing oral and written description skills.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated through listening quizzes, shorter analytic reflections, and a longer essay project developed throughout the quarter.
